radiographic_examinations.findings: Narrowing of the upper chest leading to a ‘bell-shaped’ thorax deformity. Cupping was noticeable at the anterior ends of ribs. The vertebrae were normal.
Marked sclerosis of the base and vault, underdevelopment of the paranasal sinuses and mastoid cells.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Sclerosis of the base of the skull is typically recognized by late childhood but has also been documented during infancy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Notable radiographic findings included widening, cupping, and fraying of the metaphysis of the distal radius, ulna, and metacarpals.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The changes encountered in both feet were similar to those of the hands.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Considerable metaphyseal expansion, fragmentation and calcification of the upper and lower ends of the femur with bowing.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The epiphyses of both knees were normal.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Severe shortening of the femoral neck with varus deformity and flattening of the femoral heads.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The joint spaces of both hip joints were narrowed with more involvement of the left hip.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: radiographic evaluation of the second patient
radiographic_examinations.findings: Massive sclerosis of the base, calvarium, and supraorbital ridges, with total absence of all paranasal sinuses and antegonial notching of the mandible.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: radiographic evaluation of the younger sibling (Patient 3)
radiographic_examinations.findings: Rachiti-form-like changes at the ends of all tubular bones with cupping and fraying of the metaphyses with wide growth plates; both femurs showed bowing.
